content.raw: I did get the generator expression to work in 5d77eaac2609, but it's definitely not a simplification anymore. The advantage is it has cmake populate the script with the actual library name so this code is resistant to changes elsewhere. The disadvantage is the `add_custom_command`/`add_custom_target` is a lot less clear than the original code. I'm happy to approve either the original or this.
content.html: I did get the generator expression to work in 5d77eaac2609, but it's definitely not a simplification anymore. The advantage is it has cmake populate the script with the actual library name so this code is resistant to changes elsewhere. The disadvantage is the add_custom_command/add_custom_target is a lot less clear than the original code. I'm happy to approve either the original or this.

content.raw:
I don't have a quick fix, so I'm happy approving the original version.

I think what's happening is `configure_file` runs at configure time, so the expression can't be evaluated yet. The configuring would have to be delayed to generate time by putting the generator expression in the `COMMAND` argument of `add_custom_target`.
content.html:
I don't have a quick fix, so I'm happy approving the original version.

I think what's happening is configure_file runs at configure time, so the expression can't be evaluated yet. The configuring would have to be delayed to generate time by putting the generator expression in the COMMAND argument of add_custom_target.

content.raw:
I think the relative path should be enough. The 2.8.6 docs for `install()` says:

`DESTINATION arguments specify the directory on disk to which a file will be installed. If a full path (with a leading slash or drive letter) is given it is used directly. If a relative path is given it is interpreted relative to the value of CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX.`

https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.6/cmake.html
content.html:
I think the relative path should be enough. The 2.8.6 docs for install() says:

DESTINATION arguments specify the directory on disk to which a file will be installed. If a full path (with a leading slash or drive letter) is given it is used directly. If a relative path is given it is interpreted relative to the value of CMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX.

https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.6/cmake.html

content.raw: The GNUInstallDirs module documentation claims it can be passed to the `install` command. If that doesn't work, `${CMAKE_INSTALL_FULL_DATAROOTDIR}` has the complete path.
content.html: The GNUInstallDirs module documentation claims it can be passed to the install command. If that doesn't work, ${CMAKE_INSTALL_FULL_DATAROOTDIR} has the complete path.

content.raw: I see reference to `$<TARGET_FILE_NAME: ...>` https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.6/cmake.html
content.html: I see reference to $<TARGET_FILE_NAME: ...> https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v2.8.6/cmake.html

content.raw: sdformat only uses cmake 2.8.6. Is this capability available in 2.8.6?
content.html: sdformat only uses cmake 2.8.6. Is this capability available in 2.8.6?

content.raw: `${CMAKE_INSTALL_DATAROOTDIR}` on contains the value `share`, not a complete path.
content.html: ${CMAKE_INSTALL_DATAROOTDIR} on contains the value share, not a complete path.

content.raw: This error seems to be saying the input SDF is invalid, but it hasn't actually checked the input sdf. Maybe it should say the schema-ish xml files that define sdf could not be found?
content.html: This error seems to be saying the input SDF is invalid, but it hasn't actually checked the input sdf. Maybe it should say the schema-ish xml files that define sdf could not be found?

content.raw: Even simpler `set(IGN_LIBRARY_NAME $<TARGET_FILE_NAME:sdformat>)` https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/manual/cmake-generator-expressions.7.html
content.html: Even simpler set(IGN_LIBRARY_NAME $<TARGET_FILE_NAME:sdformat>) https://cmake.org/cmake/help/v3.0/manual/cmake-generator-expressions.7.html

content.raw:
I think the if/else for library names on different platforms can be simplified to

```cmake
get_filename_component(IGN_LIBRARY_NAME $<TARGET_FILE:sdformat> NAME)
```
content.html:
I think the if/else for library names on different platforms can be simplified to

get_filename_component(IGN_LIBRARY_NAME $<TARGET_FILE:sdformat> NAME)

content.raw:
Same error
```
$ ign sdf --check test.txt
Library error: [libsdformat6.so] not found.
```

Possibly related? sdformat installs with a different .so name than the message indicates

```
lrwxrwxrwx  1 developer developer   16 Sep 15 11:25 libsdformat.so -> libsdformat.so.6
lrwxrwxrwx  1 developer developer   20 Sep 15 11:25 libsdformat.so.6 -> libsdformat.so.6.0.0
-rw-r--r--  1 developer developer 8.9M Sep 15 11:23 libsdformat.so.6.0.0
```
content.html:
Same error

$ ign sdf --check test.txt
Library error: [libsdformat6.so] not found.

Possibly related? sdformat installs with a different .so name than the message indicates

lrwxrwxrwx  1 developer developer   16 Sep 15 11:25 libsdformat.so -> libsdformat.so.6
lrwxrwxrwx  1 developer developer   20 Sep 15 11:25 libsdformat.so.6 -> libsdformat.so.6.0.0
